rev.diff:
Line 99: Line 99:
When Leigh Whannell asked Elwes what he thought about his character's fate on the commentary for the ''Saw: Uncut Edition'' DVD, Elwes responded with, "Let's face it, guys. He's severed his whole leg off. The loss of blood alone, even with that pathetic tourniquet he made with his shirt. It's a wrap. He's not going to get two blocks." [[Darren Lynn Bousman]] said on the DVD commentaries for ''Saw IV'' that his intent was to leave Dr. Gordon's fate an unanswered question and let fans make up their own minds. In a November 2009 podcast interview with Matt Horn of [[Demon FM]], he asked Patrick Melton, co-writer of ''IV'', ''V'', ''VI'' and the upcoming ''[[Saw 3D]]'', if Dr. Gordon's fate would be answered before the series ended. Melton stated that Gordon's fate would be revealed in the seventh installment of the series.<ref name= "Patrick Melton - Interview by Matt Horn / David Murphy">[http://www.demonfm.co.uk/?q=node/596/ DemonFM.co.uk]. Retrieved November 20, 2009.</ref> According to the Official Toronto Film & Television Listing sheet in February, Elwes was listed for ''Saw 3D'' though his name, along with other cast members' names, were removed two weeks later.<ref name="TFTO list">{{cite web | url=http://www.toronto.ca/tfto/pdf/currentlist.pdf | title=Toronto Film & Television Office Current List | format=PDF | work=Toronto Film & Television Office | publisher=Toronto.ca | date=February 22, 2010 | accessdate=February 27, 2010 | archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5nrhEklM3 | archivedate=February 27, 2010}}</ref> On April 25 it was confirmed by Lionsgate that he will indeed reprise his role in the final film.<ref name="Cary Elwes Confirmed">{{cite web | url=http://www.bloody-disgusting.com/news/19954/ | title=Cary Elwes Confirmed for 'Saw 3D', Full Synopsis and Cast! | work=[[Bloody Disgusting]] | publisher=The Collective | date=April 25, 2010 | accessdate=April 25, 2010}}</ref>
When Leigh Whannell asked Elwes what he thought about his character's fate on the commentary for the ''Saw: Uncut Edition'' DVD, Elwes responded with, "Let's face it, guys. He's severed his whole leg off. The loss of blood alone, even with that pathetic tourniquet he made with his shirt. It's a wrap. He's not going to get two blocks." [[Darren Lynn Bousman]] said on the DVD commentaries for ''Saw IV'' that his intent was to leave Dr. Gordon's fate an unanswered question and let fans make up their own minds. In a November 2009 podcast interview with Matt Horn of [[Demon FM]], he asked Patrick Melton, co-writer of ''IV'', ''V'', ''VI'' and the upcoming ''[[Saw 3D]]'', if Dr. Gordon's fate would be answered before the series ended. Melton stated that Gordon's fate would be revealed in the seventh installment of the series.<ref name= "Patrick Melton - Interview by Matt Horn / David Murphy">[http://www.demonfm.co.uk/?q=node/596/ DemonFM.co.uk]. Retrieved November 20, 2009.</ref> According to the Official Toronto Film & Television Listing sheet in February, Elwes was listed for ''Saw 3D'' though his name, along with other cast members' names, were removed two weeks later.<ref name="TFTO list">{{cite web | url=http://www.toronto.ca/tfto/pdf/currentlist.pdf | title=Toronto Film & Television Office Current List | format=PDF | work=Toronto Film & Television Office | publisher=Toronto.ca | date=February 22, 2010 | accessdate=February 27, 2010 | archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5nrhEklM3 | archivedate=February 27, 2010}}</ref> On April 25 it was confirmed by Lionsgate that he will indeed reprise his role in the final film.<ref name="Cary Elwes Confirmed">{{cite web | url=http://www.bloody-disgusting.com/news/19954/ | title=Cary Elwes Confirmed for 'Saw 3D', Full Synopsis and Cast! | work=[[Bloody Disgusting]] | publisher=The Collective | date=April 25, 2010 | accessdate=April 25, 2010}}</ref>
â
The first eight minutes of ''[[Saw 3D]]'', shown at [[San Diego Comic-Con International]], reveal that Dr. Gordon did survive seconds after leaving the bathroom (in the first film). It shows him dragging himself from the bathroom and placing the stump of his ankle against a hot pipe to [[Cauterization|cauterize]] it.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://shocktillyoudrop.com/news/comicconnews.php?id=15982|title=SDCC '10: First 8 Minutes of Saw 3D Screened!|work=ShockTilYouDrop|publisher=[[CraveOnline]]|date=July 23, 2010|accessdate=July 23, 2010}}</ref>. On 15th October, a clip was revealed, showing that Gordon did survive and attending a self-help group. However, he seems to mock it's creator, Bobby Dagen.
+
The first eight minutes of ''[[Saw 3D]]'', shown at [[San Diego Comic-Con International]], reveal that Dr. Gordon did survive seconds after leaving the bathroom (in the first film). It shows him dragging himself from the bathroom and placing the stump of his ankle against a hot pipe to [[Cauterization|cauterize]] it.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://shocktillyoudrop.com/news/comicconnews.php?id=15982|title=SDCC '10: First 8 Minutes of Saw 3D Screened!|work=ShockTilYouDrop|publisher=[[CraveOnline]]|date=July 23, 2010|accessdate=July 23, 2010}}</ref>
